intro: Senecio eggersii, commonly known as Eggers' groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
